result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey M Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The Court sentences Jeffrey M Miller to 30 months, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  24 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 6 months.  This sentence is to commence FORTHWITH, to be served concurrent to Ohio case 15CR373 [Wood County].

Per Wis. Stats. 973.15(3), The Court authorizes service of sentence in the State of Ohio Prison System

superMiscConds.notes: --to pay statutory costs to include DNA surcharge

--to undergo assessment, treatment,or counseling as required by the Agent

--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand

Arresting Agency: JCSD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

[MA]Case called at 8:45am 
Defendant Jeffrey M Miller in court.  Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court inquires of Mr. Miller whether he had anticipated Atty. De La Rosa appearing today.
Clerk notifies parties that Atty. De La Rosa in currently in another courtroom

recess: 8:54am--reconvene: 8:58am
Atty. De La Rosa is now present

On Defendant's Motion regarding detainer:
--Arguments given by Atty. De La Rosa 
--Response given by ADA Shock
--Statement made by Mr. Miller

The Court determines does not have authority to lift detainer. The Court denies the request to lift the detainer.

Atty. De La Rosa indicates may submit supplemental material

from ADA Shock advising he objects to the proposed order submitted by Attorney De La Rosa on 3/3/17

to Remove/Rescind/ Cancel Detainer

Letter to Defendant from ADA Shock
with Criminal Case Settlement

Case called at 9:13am [mo]
Defendant Jeffrey M Miller in court, in custody with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of " NO CONTEST  " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds  Jeffrey M Miller   guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses: Counts #2, #3, and #4

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel 
Questioning by the Court

The Court sentences  Jeffrey M Miller   to  30  months, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  24 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of   6months.  This sentence is to commence FORTHWITH, to be served concurrent to Ohio case 15CR373 [Wood County].

Per Wis. Stats. 973.15(3), The Court authorizes service of sentence in the State of Ohio Prison System

The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 

The Court gives  0   days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo assessment, treatment,or counseling as required by the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to pay statutory costs to include DNA surcharge


The Court allows 30 days to request extradition costs incurred by the State
Atty. De La Rosa is to object within 7 days of the filing, in writing

The Court suggests that the Sheriff's Department keep Mr. Miller housed at Jefferson County Jail, instead of transporting to DCI as Mr. Miller will be returning to Ohio

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess: 9:59am
Defendant's
State's

Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Miller waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information

case called at 2:10-pm. [mo]
Defendant Jeffrey M Miller appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa (PD will appoint counsel).  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
Atty. De La Rosa indicates that Mr. Miller is eligible for SPD representation

Defendant verifies date of birth, address and name of complaint
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
No Bond sought by the State due to Mr. Miller's current custody status; the Court does not require a bond
Speedy Preliminary Hearing demanded by State


recess 2:14 pm.
